text: Your company developed a really
interesting corporate culture.

I think you used the 
word "empowerment."

Can you talk a
little about that?
I don't have theories about this.
So I'm just sharing feelings
and I don't want that you
misinterpret my words
like I have a theory about this.

So apologies if it
seems theoretical.

People usually when
they join a company,

they want to learn,
they want to compete.
They want to make more money.

They want to see
a better future.
And to feel this.

To feel safety, to feel
that they are learning

and to feel that they
are on the right path.

This is your
feeling when you are

at the beginning of your career
or the first years, you know.
But then you want more.
You want more.

And more is usually
meaning, you know--
to have beyond the work itself.

You want to feel that you
are in the right place

and you are doing
the right things,

and your effect on your
neighborhood or your city

or your community
or your country

is positive or in
the environment
is positive and not negative.

I think now it's more 
and more the case.

But it was always the
case of young people

that went to universities,
had good education.

They want to
change the world.
And they are right.
And they are right,

because there are terrible
things around us, you know.
So if you want to do this,

you need to make the company
more than a business

and you need to make people
participate in this adventure

so they can try to change
the world around us
with successes and failures.

And failures are also
very good lessons.

We had a very big
failure in empowerment.
But we had a lot of successes

and this also creates
a feeling of a group,

and that you are not
only there to make money

or to fix software or
to create new versions

but you are doing
more than that.
You are part of the world.

You are not part of a company,
you are part of the world.

I think the day you feel
that in the place you work,

you are not only working from
9:00 to 6:00 or 9:00 to 5:00

and earning your
salary and leaving
and just doing this for life--

but that you have an
impact around you,

that it has a meaning,
what you are doing,
it changes everything in your life.
